questions.explanation:
Shaquille O'Neal, LAL.

	Shaq won the MVP for the second time in his career. He won both of his MVP's as a Western Conferance All-Star.

Western Conference.

	The west won for the 4th time in five years.

questions.text: Who led the Eastern Conference in scoring?
questions.explanation:
Jamaal Magliore, NO.

	Magliore, who is not considered to be a prolific scorer, was a suprise to lead East team in scoring with 22 points.

questions.text: Who was the leading vote getter for the game?
questions.explanation:
Vince Carter, TOR.

	Carter(East) was the leading vote getter for the 4th straight year.

questions.text: Was Lebron James of the Cavaliers an All-Star?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Lebron was not an All-Star as a rookie. Though many around the league thought he should have been.

questions.text: What city hosted the All-Star game?
questions.explanation:
Los Angeles.

	This was the first time since 1982 that Los Angeles hosted the All-Star game.

questions.text: Carmelo Anthony of the Nuggets was an All-Star.
questions.explanation:
False.

	There were no rookie All-Stars in 2004.

questions.text: Which team had the better All-Star record at the end of this game?
questions.explanation:
East.

	Th East had a win/loss record of 32-21.

questions.text: How many first time All-Stars played/coached in the game?
questions.explanation:
8.

	4 for the east and 2 for the west, and both coaches were first timers.

questions.text: Did Allen Iverson of the 76ers score more than 10 points?
questions.explanation:
No.

	He scored only 2 points in the 2004 game. Iverson played his fifth straight game for the Eastern Conference
